intro: Billotia theiformis, commonly known as the silky mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the Viscaraceae family. It is native to eastern Australia and thrives on the branches of eucalyptus trees. The plant is characterized by its pale green, leathery leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in spring. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Billotia theiformis plays a role in the ecosystem by providing food for various native animals and contributing to the biodiversity of its host trees.
